summary: This is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a specific phone line for 60 days. The surveillance is part of a criminal investigation into potential violations of 18 U.S.C. § 1591 (sex trafficking) involving a target identified as 'FNU LNU' and others. The subscriber name and phone number are redacted.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office is submitting the application for the surveillance order.

persons.name: Robert W. Lehrburger
persons.context: He is the judge who signed the order authorizing the installation and use of the pen register and trap-and-trace device.

events.title: Court Authorizes Pen Register Surveillance
events.description: A U.S. Magistrate Judge signs an order authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a specific phone line for 60 days as part of a sex trafficking investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI was conducting a criminal investigation into potential violations of 18 U.S.C. § 1591 (sex trafficking) against a target identified as 'FNU LNU' (First Name Unknown, Last Name Unknown) and others.
On June 27, 2019, the court authorized a 60-day pen register/trap-and-trace surveillance on a specific Verizon phone line, seeking non-content call detail records and IP address information.
The application and order are sealed, and the provider (Verizon) was ordered not to disclose the existence of the surveillance or the investigation.
The target phone's subscriber name and phone number are fully redacted in the document.
The legal authority for the surveillance was sought under 18 U.S.C. §§ 3121-26, specifically for an investigation into possible sex trafficking crimes.
